channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Paving cracked which is a trip hazard, 19th February
item.description:
This was previously reported as this was caused by council contractors driving there lorry on the pavement to fix another piece or pavement. This is outside of my property 220 Hurst Road, as you can see from the picture a person has marked outside my neighbours property but has missed mine when it is worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 218, Hurst Road, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several overflowing bins near the Bee Hive, 19th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Meeting House Lane, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: The green spacce fence got rotten and felt down on both sides of these little green spaces creating a hazard for kids and animals, 19th February
item.description:
Most poles are rotten and some felt down, some still hanging creating a hazzard for kids, people and animals in the area as can fall anytime and kit somebody or you might just trip over during the dark nights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Buttermere Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: So much dog poo in peckham, 19th February
item.description:
I stepped in dog poo this morning in Peckham and it is a hugely growing problem. I am constantly dodging MASSIVE bits of dog poo all the time and it is so disgusting. Please can you start properly enforcing fines or putting up signs as it is a terrible representation of the area. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eaton Walk, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes at least 10 along this road, 19th February
item.description:
There are at least 10 potholes along this road, deep and dangerous as trying to miss them whilst driving, with the rain they have filled up so you cant see them, and drive over them. They are deep and damaging to car especially if you are driving this road 2 or 3 times a day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 167, Main Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
